TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BulletDecorator extends System.Windows.Controls.Decorator

Docs.summary: Represents a layout control that aligns a bullet and another visual object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> has two content properties: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> property defines the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> to use as a bullet. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> property defines a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> that visually aligns with the bullet.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> always aligns with the first line of text when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object is not a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> aligns to the center of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> object. For more information about layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator>, see [How to: Create a BulletDecorator](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms753295(v=vs.90)).
The following illustration shows examples of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> controls.
![3 BulletDecorators: CheckBox, RadioButton, TextBox](~/add/media/bulletdecorator.png "3 BulletDecorators: CheckBox, RadioButton, TextBox")
## Examples The following examples show how to define a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> control.
[!code-csharp[BulletPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BulletPanelExample/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[BulletPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BulletPanelExample/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#1)] [!code-xaml[BulletPanelExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BulletPanelExample/CSharp/Window1.xaml#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.ArrangeOverride%2A> method determines the size and position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> objects. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> is aligned vertically with the first line of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> content.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color for a control.
Docs.value: The background color for the and of a . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The property defines the to use to fill the area within the . For some parent layout elements, the area that is defined for the may extend beyond its and content. For example, if the is the single child of a cell in a control, the property applies to the whole cell. This occurs because the content in a cell is stretched in all directions to fill the cell, by default. However, if you set the property to for the , the property only affects the actual content area of the . Alternatively, you can enclose the in a element. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, | ## Examples The following examples show how to set the property on a control. Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object to use as the bullet in a .
Docs.value: The to use as the bullet. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The property is a content property of the control and defines the to display as a bullet for the object. The bullet that is defined by setting the property to a is the first visual element in a control. The single element is the second visual element. ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## Examples The following examples show how to set the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks The visual child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> are the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> properties.

Protected Friend Overrides ReadOnly Property LogicalChildren As IEnumerator
protected public: virtual property System::Collections::IEnumerator ^ LogicalChildren { System::Collections::IEnumerator ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator for the logical child elements of the control.
Docs.value: The enumerator that provides access to the logical child elements of the control. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The logical child elements for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> control include the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>. If you set both properties, they are enumerated in the following order: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A>.
The number of visual child elements is the same as the number of logical child elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnRender(class System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext dc) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnRender (dc As DrawingContext)

Docs.summary: Renders the content of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method creates a <xref:System.Windows.Rect> structure that is sized for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator> content. This rectangular structure is displayed with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Background%2A> color and no border.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property VisualChildrenCount As Integer
protected: virtual property int VisualChildrenCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of visual child elements for the control.
Docs.value: The number of visual elements that are defined for the . The default is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.VisualChildrenCount%2A> can be 0, 1, or 2. If either the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> element is defined, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.VisualChildrenCount%2A> is 1. If both the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.Bullet%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> element are defined, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.BulletDecorator.VisualChildrenCount%2A> is 2.
The number of visual child elements is the same as the number of logical child elements.
